cards.name: Tangela
cards.text: Many writhing vines cover it, so its true identity remains unknown. The blue vines grow its whole life long.

attacks.name: Flog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Tangrowth
cards.text: Even if one of its arms is eaten, it's fine. The Pokémon regenerates quickly and will go right back to normal.

attacks.name: Bind Down
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

attacks.name: Flog
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Shuckle
cards.text: The berries stored in its vaselike shell eventually become a thick, pulpy juice.

attacks.name: Share
attacks.text: Heal 40 damage from 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Stab
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 40 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Cherubi
cards.text: The small ball is not only filled with nutrients, it is also tasty. Starly try to peck it off.

attacks.name: Double Spin
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Carnivine
cards.text: Using its tentacles to lash itself to trees, it lies in wait for prey, luring it close with sweet-smelling drool.

attacks.name: Ambush Bite
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage and discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Snivy
cards.text: They photosynthesize by bathing their tails in sunlight. When they are not feeling well, their tails droop.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Servine
cards.text: They avoid attacks by sinking into the shadows of thick foliage. They retaliate with masterful whipping techniques.

attacks.name: Wring Out
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed and discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Serperior

abilities.name: Royal Heal
abilities.text: At any time between turns, heal 10 damage from each of your Pokémon.

cards.text: They raise their heads to intimidate opponents but only give it their all when fighting a powerful opponent.

attacks.name: Leaf Tornado
attacks.text: Move as many Grass Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Sewaddle
cards.text: Leavanny dress it in clothes they made for it when it hatched. It hides its head in its hood while it is sleeping.

attacks.name: Leaf Boomerang
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Sewaddle
cards.text: Since this Pokémon makes its own clothes out of leaves, it is a popular mascot for fashion designers.

cards.name: Swadloon
cards.text: Forests where Swadloon live have superb foliage because the nutrients they make from fallen leaves nourish the plant life.

attacks.name: String Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Leavanny

abilities.name: Leaf Tailor
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Energy attached to it has no Weakness.

cards.text: Upon finding a small Pokémon, it weaves clothing for it from leaves, using the cutters on its arms and sticky silk.

attacks.name: Cutting Arm
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Dwebble
cards.text: When it finds a stone of a suitable size, it secretes a liquid from its mouth to open up a hole to crawl into.

cards.name: Crustle
cards.text: When its boulder is broken in battles for territory, it feels unsure and begins to weaken.

attacks.name: Hard Press
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Virizion
cards.text: Its head sprouts horns as sharp as blades. Using whirlwind-like movements, it confounds and swiftly cuts opponents.

attacks.name: Double Draw
attacks.text: Draw 2 cards.

attacks.name: Leaf Wallop
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Leaf Wallop does 40 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Genesect
cards.text: This Pokémon existed 300 million years ago. Team Plasma altered it and attached a cannon to its back.

attacks.name: Gaia Blaster
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Grass Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Charmander
cards.text: The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If healthy, its tail burns intensely.

attacks.name: Draw In
attacks.text: Attach 2 Fire Energy cards from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Charmeleon
cards.text: In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.

attacks.name: Raging Claws
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Charizard
cards.text: It is said that Charizard's fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.

attacks.name: Split Bomb
attacks.text: This attack does 40 damage to 2 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Scorching Fire
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Vulpix
cards.text: As each tail grows, its fur becomes more lustrous. When held, it feels slightly warm.

attacks.name: Firebreathing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Ninetales
cards.text: Each of its nine tails is imbued with supernatural power, and it can live for a thousand years.

attacks.name: Color Coordination
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any basic Energy attached to it that is the same type as the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 40 more damage.

cards.name: Moltres
cards.text: One of the legendary bird Pokémon. It is said that its appearance indicates the coming of spring.

attacks.name: Searing Flame
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

attacks.name: Fire Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Victini

abilities.name: Victory Star
abilities.text: Once during your turn, after you flip any coins for an attack, you may ignore all effects of those coin flips and being flipping those coins again. You can't use more than 1 Victory Star Ability each turn.

cards.text: This Pokémon brings victory. It is said that Trainers with Victini always win, regardless of the type of encounter.

attacks.name: Stored Power
attacks.text: Move all Energy attached to this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Victini-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Turbo Energize
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 basic Energy cards and attach them to your Benched Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Intensifying Burn
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon is a Pokémon-EX, this attack does 50 more damage.

cards.name: Tepig
cards.text: It can deftly dodge its foe's attacks while shooting fireballs from its nose. It roasts berries before it eats them.

attacks.name: Take Down
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Pignite
cards.text: When its internal fire flares up, its movements grow sharper and faster. When it trouble, it emits smoke.

attacks.name: Flamethrower
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Emboar

abilities.name: Inferno Fandango
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may attach a Fire Energy card from your hand to 1 of your Pokémon.

cards.text: It can throw a fire punch by setting its fists on fire with its fiery chin. It cares deeply about its friends.

cards.name: Reshiram
cards.text: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 or more for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Reshiram-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glinting Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Brave Fire
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 50 damage to itself.

cards.name: Magikarp
cards.text: A Magikarp living for many years can leap a mountain using Splash. The move remains useless, though.

attacks.name: Flailing Flop
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 10 damage to itself.

cards.name: Gyarados
cards.text: Once it begins to rampage, a Gyarados will burn everything down, even in a harsh storm.

attacks.name: Howling Rampage
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Prize cards both players have taken.

cards.name: Articuno
cards.text: A legendary bird Pokémon. It can create blizzards by freezing moisture in the air.

attacks.name: Ice Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Piplup
cards.text: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Prinplup
cards.text: Because every Prinplup considers itself to be the most important, they can never form a group.

attacks.name: Water Splash
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Empoleon
cards.text: If anyone were to hurt its pride, it would slash them with wings that can cleave through an ice floe.

attacks.name: Emperor's Strike
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has fewer remaining HP than the Defending Pokémon, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Phione
cards.text: It drifts in warm seas. It always returns to where it was born, no matter how far it may have drifted.

attacks.name: Pull Out
attacks.text: Put a card from your discard pile on top of your deck.

attacks.name: Aqua Boomerang
attacks.text: Return this Pokémon and all cards attached to it to your hand.

cards.name: Oshawott
cards.text: The scalchop on its stomach is made from the same elements as claws. It detaches the scalchop for use as a blade.

attacks.name: Razor Shell
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Dewott
cards.text: Scalchop techniques differ from one Dewott to another. It never neglects maintaining its scalchops.

attacks.name: Aqua Tail
attacks.text: Flip a coin for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon. This attack does 10 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Samurott

abilities.name: Shell Armor
abilities.text: Any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Part of the armor on its anterior legs becomes a giant sword. Its cry alone is enough to intimidate most enemies.

attacks.name: Hydro Pump
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Tympole
cards.text: By vibrating its cheeks, it emits sound waves imperceptible to humans. It uses the rhythm of these sounds to talk.

cards.name: Palpitoad
cards.text: It lives in the water and on land. It uses its long, sticky tongue to capture prey.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

cards.name: Seismitoad
cards.text: It increases the power of its punches by vibrating the bumps on its fists. It can turn a boulder to rubble with one punch.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

cards.name: Kyurem
cards.text: It generates a powerful, freezing energy inside itself, but its body became frozen when the energy leaked out.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Glaciate
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Kyurem-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Frozen Wings
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hail Blizzard
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't use Hail Blizzard during your next turn.

cards.name: Keldeo-EX

abilities.name: Rush In
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), if this Pokémon is on your Bench, you may switch this Pokémon with your Active Pokémon.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Secret Sword
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Water Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Zapdos
cards.text: A legendary Pokémon that is said to live in thunderclouds. It freely controls lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Random Spark
attacks.text: This attack does 50 damage to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

attacks.name: Thundering Hurricane
attacks.text: Flip 4 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Plusle
cards.text: It cheers on friends with pom-poms made of sparks. It drains power from telephone poles.

attacks.name: Tag Draw
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw 4 cards. If Minun is on your Bench, draw 4 more cards.

attacks.name: Positive Ion
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 10 more damage.

cards.name: Minun
cards.text: It cheers on friends. If its friends are losing, its body lets off more and more sparks.

attacks.name: Negative Ion
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 30 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

attacks.name: Electrishower
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Emolga
cards.text: They live on treetops and glide using the inside of a cape-like membrane while discharging electricity.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Thundurus
cards.text: The spikes on its tail discharge immense bolts of lightning. It flies around the Unova region firing off lightning bolts.

attacks.name: Charge
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Lightning Energy card and attach it to this Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Disaster Volt
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Zekrom
cards.text: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

cards.name: Zekrom-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Glinting Claw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

attacks.name: Strong Volt
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Mewtwo
cards.text: A Pokémon created by recombining Mew's genes. It's said to have the most savage heart among Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psyslash
attacks.text: Discard 2 Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Mewtwo-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: X Ball
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the amount of Energy attached to this Pokémon and the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Psydrive
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Natu
cards.text: It picks food from cactus plants, deftly avoiding buds and spines. It seems to skip about to move.

cards.name: Xatu
cards.text: This odd Pokémon can see both the past and the future. It eyes the sun's movement all day.

attacks.name: Fortunate Draw
attacks.text: You and your opponent play Rock-Paper-Scissors. The player who wins draws 3 cards. The player who loses discards the top 3 cards of his or her deck.

attacks.name: Miracle Wing
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Misdreavus
cards.text: A Pokémon that startles people in the middle of the night. It gathers fear as its energy.

cards.name: Mismagius
cards.text: Its cry sounds like an incantation. It is said the cry may rarely be imbued with happiness-giving power.

attacks.name: Absorb Life
attacks.text: Heal 10 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ralts
cards.text: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Kirlia
cards.text: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

attacks.name: Mind Bend
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Sableye
cards.text: It hides in the darkness of caves. Its diet of gems has transformed its eyes into gemstones.

attacks.name: Tight Jaw
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Croagunk
cards.text: Inflating its poison sacs, it fills the area with an odd sound and hits flinching opponents with a poison jab.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Toxicroak
cards.text: The croaking that Toxicroak produces before a battle is for churning the poison it has stored in its poison sac.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Poison Jab
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Woobat
cards.text: The heart-shaped mark left on a body after a Woobat has been attached to it is said to bring good fortune.

attacks.name: Dual Cut
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Swoobat
cards.text: It shakes its tail vigorously when it emits ultrasonic waves strong enough to reduce concrete to rubble.

attacks.name: Energy Gift
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, search your deck for 2 Psychic Energy cards and attach them to your Pokémon in any way you like. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Sigilyph

abilities.name: Safeguard
abilities.text: Prevent all effects of attacks, including damage, done to this Pokémon by Pokémon-EX.

cards.text: The guardians of an ancient city, they use their psychic power to attack enemies that invade their territory.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Trubbish
cards.text: Inhaling the gas they belch will make you sleep for a week. They prefer unsanitary places.

attacks.name: Poison Gas
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Poisoned.

cards.name: Garbodor

abilities.name: Garbotoxin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has a Pokémon Tool card attached to it, each Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities (except for Garbotoxin).

cards.text: It clenches opponents with its left arm and finishes them off with foul-smelling poison gas belched from its mouth.

cards.name: Gothita
cards.text: Their ribbonlike feelers increase their psychic power. They are always staring at something.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Gothita
cards.text: It stares intently at everything. It can become so obsessed with watching that it doesn't notice attacks.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Gothorita
cards.text: They use hypnosis to control people and Pokémon. Tales of Gothorita leading people astray are told in every corner.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Gothitelle

abilities.name: Magic Room
abilities.text: As long as this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon, your opponent can't play any Item cards from his or her hand.

cards.text: Starry skies thousands of light-years away are visible in the space distorted by their intense psychic power.

attacks.name: Madkinesis
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Solosis
cards.text: They drive away attackers by unleashing psychic power. They can use telepathy to talk with others

cards.name: Solosis
cards.text: Because their bodies are enveloped in a special liquid, they are fine in any environment, no matter how severe.

attacks.name: Nap
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Duosion
cards.text: Since they have two divided brains, at times they suddenly try to take two different actions at once.

cards.name: Reuniclus
cards.text: When Reuniclus shake hands, a network forms between their brains, increasing their psychic power.

attacks.name: Future Sight
attacks.text: Look at the top 5 cards of your deck and put them back on top of your deck in any order.

attacks.name: Net Force
attacks.text: Does 40 damage times the number of Reuniclus you have in play.

cards.name: Chandelure-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Cursed Drop
attacks.text: Put 4 damage counters on your opponent's Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Eerie Glow
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Burned and Confused.

cards.name: Meloetta
cards.text: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

attacks.name: Psychic
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Riolu
cards.text: It has the peculiar power of being able to see emotions such as joy and rage in the form of waves.

attacks.name: Quick Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Lucario

abilities.name: Reflexive Retaliation
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: A well-trained one can sense auras to identify and take in the feelings of creatures over half a mile away.

attacks.name: Aura Sphere
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Gallade
cards.text: When trying to protect someone, it extends its elbows as if they were swords and fights savagely.

attacks.name: Nerve Shot
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Pandemonium Blade
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each of your Benched Pokémon that has any damage counters on it.

cards.name: Excadrill-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dig Out
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your deck. If that card is a basic Energy card, attach it to 1 of your Pokémon.

attacks.name: Break Ground
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each of your Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Stunfisk
cards.text: It conceals itself in the mud of the seashore. Then it waits. When prey touch it, it delivers a jolt of electricity.

attacks.name: Muddy Water
attacks.text: Does 20 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon).

attacks.name: Rumble
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Terrakion
cards.text: Its charge is strong enough to break through a giant castle wall in one blow. This Pokémon is spoken of in legends.

attacks.name: Retaliate
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 60 more damage.

cards.name: Landorus
cards.text: Lands visited by Landorus grant such bountiful crops that it has been hailed as "The Guardian of the Fields."

attacks.name: Abundant Harvest
attacks.text: Attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Gaia Hammer
attacks.text: Does 10 damage to each Benched Pokémon (both yours and your opponent's). (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Meloetta
cards.text: The melodies sung by Meloetta have the power to make Pokémon that hear them happy or sad.

attacks.name: Magical Dance
attacks.text: Heal 30 damage from each of your Benched Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shooting Star Pirouette
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 more damage for each heads.

cards.name: Spiritomb

abilities.name: Sealing Scream
abilities.text: Each player can't play any ACE SPEC cards from his or her hand.

cards.text: Its constant mischief and misdeeds resulted in it being bound to an Odd Keystone by a mysterious spell.

attacks.name: Hexed Mirror
attacks.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck. Then, draw a number of cards equal to the number of cards in your opponent's hand.

cards.name: Darkrai-EX

abilities.name: Dark Cloak
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon that has any Darkness Energy attached to it has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Night Spear
attacks.text: Does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Zorua
cards.text: It changes into the forms of others to surprise them. Apparently, it often transforms into a silent child.

attacks.name: Ascension
attacks.text: Search your deck for a card that evolves from this Pokémon and put it onto this Pokémon. (This counts as evolving this Pokémon.) Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Zoroark
cards.text: Bonds between these Pokémon are very strong. It protects the safety of its pack by tricking its opponents.

attacks.name: Brutal Bash
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of Darkness Pokémon you have in play.

attacks.name: Dark Rush
attacks.text: Does 20 damage times the number of damage counters on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Cobalion
cards.text: It has a body and heart of steel. Its glare is sufficient to make even an unruly Pokémon obey it.

attacks.name: Energy Press
attacks.text: Does 20 more damage for each Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Iron Breaker
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't attack during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Altaria
cards.text: On sunny days, it flies freely through the sky and blends into the clouds. It sings in a beautiful soprano.

attacks.name: Cleave
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. If both of them are heads, discard all Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Rayquaza
cards.text: It lives in the ozone layer far above the clouds and cannot be seen from the ground.

attacks.name: Dragon Pulse
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Gible
cards.text: It attacks using its huge mouth. While its attacks are powerful, it hurts itself out of clumsiness, too.

cards.name: Gabite
cards.text: It loves sparkly things. It seeks treasures in caves and hoards the loot in its nest.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Garchomp
cards.text: It is said that when one runs at high speed, its wings create blades of wind that can fell nearby trees.

attacks.name: Mach Cut
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

attacks.name: Dragonblade
attacks.text: Discard the top 2 cards of your deck.

cards.name: Deino
cards.text: It tends to bite everything, and it is not a picky eater. Approaching it carelessly is dangerous.

attacks.name: Deep Growl
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Power Breath
attacks.text: Discard an Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Zweilous
cards.text: After it has eaten up all the food in its territory, it moves to another area. Its two heads do not get along.

attacks.name: Crunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Hydreigon

abilities.name: Dark Trance
abilities.text: As often as you like during your turn (before your attack), you may move a Darkness Energy attached to 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.

cards.text: This brutal Pokémon travels the skies on its six wings. Anything that moves seems like a foe to it, triggering its attack.

attacks.name: Dragonblast
attacks.text: Discard 2 Darkness Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Black Kyurem-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Fang
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Freeze Shock
attacks.text: This Pokémon can't attack during your next turn.

cards.name: White Kyurem-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Dragon Stream
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, attach a basic Energy card from your discard pile to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Ice Burn
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon. The Defending Pokémon is now Burned.

cards.name: Lugia-EX

abilities.name: Overflow
abilities.text: If your opponent's Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an attack of this Pokémon, take 1 more Prize card.

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Plasma Gale
attacks.text: Discard a Plasma Energy attached to this Pokémon. If you can't discard a Plasma Energy, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Swablu
cards.text: For some reason, it likes to land on people's heads softly and act like it's a hat.

attacks.name: Glare and Peck
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Minccino
cards.text: These Pokémon prefer a tidy habitat. They are always sweeping and dusting, using their tails as brooms.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Basic Pokémon and put it onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Cinccino

abilities.name: Smooth Coat
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

cards.text: Their white fur is coated in a special oil that makes it easy for them to deflect attacks.

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Druddigon

abilities.name: Rough Skin
abilities.text: If this Pokémon is your Active Pokémon and is damaged by an opponent's attack (even if this Pokémon is Knocked Out), put 2 damage counters on the Attacking Pokémon.

cards.text: It races through narrow caves, using its sharp claws to catch prey. The skin on its face is harder than a rock.

attacks.name: Clutch
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Bouffalant
cards.text: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

attacks.name: Revenge
attacks.text: If any of your Pokémon were Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack during his or her last turn, this attack does 70 more damage.

attacks.name: Head Charge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this Pokémon does 20 damage to itself.

cards.name: Tornadus
cards.text: The lower half of its body is wrapped in a cloud of energy. It zooms through the sky at 200 mph.

attacks.name: Energy Wheel
attacks.text: Move an Energy from 1 of your Benched Pokémon to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Hurricane
attacks.text: Move a basic Energy from this Pokémon to 1 of your Benched Pokémon.

cards.name: Bianca
cards.text: Draw cards until you have 6 cards in your hand.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Cedric Juniper
cards.text: Put a Pokémon from your hand face down in front of you and tell your opponent its name. Your opponent guesses the height of that Pokémon. Reveal that Pokémon. If your opponent guessed right, he or she draws 3 cards. If your opponent guessed wrong, you draw 3 cards. Return the Pokémon to your hand. (You can't choose a Pokémon that doesn't have the height printed on the card.),You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Crushing Hammer
cards.text: Flip a coin. If heads, discard an Energy attached to 1 of your opponent's Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Energy Switch
cards.text: Move a basic Energy from 1 of your Pokémon to another of your Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Double Colorless Energy
cards.text: Double Colorless Energy provides ColorlessColorless Energy.

cards.name: Reshiram
cards.text: This Pokémon appears in legends. It sends flames into the air from its tail, burning up everything around it.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Zekrom
cards.text: This Pokémon appears in legends. In its tail, it has a giant generator that creates electricity.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Bolt Strike
attacks.text: This Pokémon does 40 damage to itself.

cards.name: Snivy
cards.text: Being exposed to sunlight makes its movements swifter. It uses vines more adeptly than its hands.

attacks.name: Growth
attacks.text: Attach a Grass Energy from your hand to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Servine
cards.text: When it gets dirty, its leaves can't be used in photosynthesis, so it always keeps itself clean.

attacks.name: Leaf Blade
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Serperior

abilities.name: Royal Garden
abilities.text: If this Pokémon has any Grass Energy attached to it, this Pokémon has no Retreat Cost.

cards.text: It only gives its all against strong opponents who are not fazed by the glare from Serperior's noble eyes.

cards.name: Growlithe
cards.text: Extremely loyal to its Trainer, it will bark at those who approach the Trainer unexpectedly and run them out of town.

attacks.name: Rest
attacks.text: Heal all damage from this Pokémon. This Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Lunge
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Torchic
cards.text: A fire burns inside, so it feels very warm to hug. It launches fireballs of 1,800 degrees F.

cards.name: Piplup
cards.text: A poor walker, it often falls down. However, its strong pride makes it puff up its chest without a care.

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Pikachu
cards.text: It occasionally uses an electric shock to recharge a fellow Pikachu that is in a weakened state.

attacks.name: Thundershock
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

cards.name: Ralts
cards.text: If its horns capture the warm feelings of people or Pokémon, its body warms up slightly.

attacks.name: Hypnotic Gaze
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Asleep.

cards.name: Kirlia
cards.text: If its Trainer becomes happy, it overflows with energy, dancing joyously while spinning about.

attacks.name: Tiptoe Step
attacks.text: Draw a card for each Psychic Energy attached to this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Double Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 20 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Gardevoir
cards.text: To protect its Trainer, it will expend all its psychic power to create a small black hole.

attacks.name: Psybeam
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Eternal Radiance
attacks.text: Move all damage counters from this Pokémon to the Defending Pokémon. This Pokémon can't use Eternal Radiance during your next turn.

cards.name: Meloetta-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brilliant Voice
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.

cards.name: Stunfisk
cards.text: When its opponent can't be paralyzed, it contorts itself with unexpected speed and flops away.

attacks.name: Attract
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Purrloin
cards.text: Their cute act is a ruse. They trick people and steal their valuables just to see the looks on their faces.

attacks.name: Captivate
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, switch 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon with the Defending Pokémon.

cards.name: Eevee
cards.text: Thanks to its unstable genetic makeup, this special Pokémon conceals many different possible evolutions.

attacks.name: Surprise Attack
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Teddiursa
cards.text: It lets honey soak into its paws so it can lick them all the time. Every set of paws tastes unique.

attacks.name: Honey Snack
attacks.text: Heal 20 damage from this Pokémon.

cards.name: Ursaring
cards.text: In its territory, it leaves scratches on trees that bear delicious berries or fruits.

attacks.name: Picnic Weather
attacks.text: Put a Teddiursa from your discard pile onto your Bench. Then, attach an Energy card from your discard pile to that Pokémon.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 50 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Audino
cards.text: Using the feelers on its ears, it can tell how someone is feeling or when an egg might hatch.

attacks.name: Relaxed Roll
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 30 damage times the number heads.

cards.name: Minccino
cards.text: Minccino greet each other by grooming one another thoroughly with their tails.

attacks.name: Tail Slap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 10 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Cinccino

abilities.name: Smooth Coat
abilities.text: If any damage is done to this Pokémon by attacks, flip a coin. If heads, prevent that damage.

cards.text: Cinccino's body is coated in a special oil that helps it deflect attacks, such as punches.

attacks.name: Echoed Voice
attacks.text: During your next turn, this Pokémon's Echoed Voice attack does 50 more damage (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Elesa
cards.text: Search your deck for 3 Pokémon Tool cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Shaymin-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Synthesis
attacks.text: Search your deck for a Grass Energy card and attach it to 1 of your Pokémon. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Revenge Blast
attacks.text: Does 30 more damage for each Prize card your opponent has taken.

cards.name: Reshiram
cards.text: This legendary Pokémon can scorch the world with fire. It helps those who want to build a world of truth.

attacks.name: Outrage
attacks.text: Does 10 more damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

attacks.name: Blue Flare
attacks.text: Discard 2 Fire Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Emolga
cards.text: It glides on its outstretched membrane while shocking foes with the electricity stored in the pouches on its cheeks.

attacks.name: Call for Family
attacks.text: Search your deck for 2 Basic Pokémon and put them onto your Bench. Shuffle your deck afterward.

cards.name: Mew-EX

abilities.name: Versatile
abilities.text: This Pokémon can use the attacks of any Pokémon in play (both yours and your opponent's). (You still need the necessary Energy to use each attack.)

cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Replace
attacks.text: Move as many Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

cards.name: Meloetta-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brilliant Voice
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, the Defending Pokémon is now Asleep. If tails, the Defending Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Round
attacks.text: Does 30 damage times the number of your Pokémon that have the Round attack.
